design_guidelines.md.content:
# UNHCR Rights-Mapper Design Guidelines

## Design Approach

**Selected System:** Modern Professional Application with Chat Interface Pattern
**Justification:** A utility-focused legal assistance tool requiring trust, clarity, and efficient case management. The chat-based interface provides familiar conversation tracking while maintaining professional authority for legal work.

**Core Design Principles:**
1. **Modern Simplicity** - Clean, rounded components with generous whitespace
2. **Conversation-Centered** - Each case tracked as an accessible chat thread
3. **Professional Clarity** - Legal information hierarchy over decorative elements
4. **Seamless Navigation** - Fluid transitions between intake, verification, and report views

---

## Typography System

### Font Families
- **Primary:** Inter (interface, headings, labels)
- **Legal Content:** Georgia or serif (report body, citations)
- **Monospace:** JetBrains Mono (case IDs, timestamps)

### Type Scale
- **App Title/Hero:** text-3xl to text-4xl, font-bold
- **Page Headers:** text-2xl, font-semibold
- **Section Headers:** text-xl, font-semibold
- **Chat Messages:** text-base
- **Body/Forms:** text-base
- **Labels/Meta:** text-sm, font-medium
- **Timestamps:** text-xs

### Hierarchy
- Conversation list: text-sm with font-semibold for case titles
- Active chat indicator: font-bold treatment
- Legal citations: text-sm, italic serif

---

## Layout System

### Spacing Primitives
**Core Units:** Tailwind spacing of **3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20**
- **p-6 to p-8:** Card/panel padding
- **gap-4, gap-6:** Component spacing
- **mb-6, mb-8:** Section separation
- **rounded-xl, rounded-2xl:** Modern rounded corners throughout

### Application Shell
**Two-Column Layout:**
- **Left Sidebar (Chat List):** Fixed width w-80, full height, sticky
  - Top: "New Case" button (p-4, mb-4)
  - Conversation list (scrollable, space-y-2)
  - Each conversation: p-4, rounded-xl, clickable card
  - Active conversation: distinct treatment
  
- **Main Content Area:** flex-1, overflow-y-auto
  - Inner container: max-w-5xl mx-auto, px-8
  - Consistent top padding: pt-12

### Container Widths
- **Intake Screen:** max-w-3xl mx-auto (focused input)
- **Verification Dashboard:** max-w-4xl mx-auto
- **Legal Report:** max-w-5xl mx-auto (optimal document width)

---

## Screen-Specific Layouts

### Chat Sidebar Structure
**Conversation Cards:**
- Case title (truncate, font-semibold, mb-1)
- Last activity timestamp (text-xs)
- Status badge (Draft/Verified/Completed)
- Border-l-4 for status indicator stripe

**Sidebar Header:**
- App logo/title at top (p-6)
- "New Case" primary button (w-full, mb-6)
- Search/filter input (mb-4, rounded-full)

### Screen 1: Smart Intake
**Layout:**
- Page title with icon (mb-8)
- Large textarea component (min-h-80, rounded-2xl, p-6)
- Label above: "Paste Unstructured Case Notes" (mb-3)
- Placeholder example text shown
- Helper text below (text-sm, mb-6)
- Primary CTA button (mt-8, px-8 py-4, rounded-full)
- Substantial whitespace (py-16)

### Screen 2: Verification Dashboard
**Two-Section Layout:**

**Section 1 - Extracted Facts:**
- Header with verification icon (mb-6)
- Fact cards in single column (space-y-4)
- Each card: p-6, rounded-xl, key-value pairs
- Status badges for categories (rounded-full, px-3 py-1)
- Edit icons on hover for each fact

**Section 2 - Missing Information:**
- Clear header with instruction text (mb-8)
- Question cards (space-y-6)
- Each card: p-6, rounded-xl, numbered
- Radio groups with clear spacing (space-y-3)
- Checkbox groups with generous padding
- Submit button (mt-12, w-full md:w-auto, rounded-full)

**Visual Separation:**
- Border-t between sections (mt-12, pt-12)
- Both sections contained in max-w-4xl

### Screen 3: Legal Report
**Document Layout:**
- Report header with metadata (mb-12)
  - Title (text-3xl, font-bold)
  - Case ID and timestamp (text-sm, right-aligned)
  
**Per-Need Section:**
- Need category header with icon (text-2xl, mb-8)
- AI Summary card (p-8, rounded-2xl, mb-8, border-l-4)
  - "Summary" label (uppercase, text-xs, tracking-wide, mb-3)
  - Summary text (leading-relaxed)
  
- Legal Basis subsection (mb-8)
  - Subheader (text-lg, font-semibold, mb-4)
  - Article text (serif, leading-relaxed, text-justify)
  
- Citation box (p-6, rounded-xl, mb-12)
  - "Source Citation" label (uppercase, text-xs, mb-2)
  - Quote text (serif, italic, mb-2)
  - Source reference (font-medium)

**Section Spacing:**
- space-y-16 between need sections
- Print-friendly page breaks

---

## Component Library

### Chat Components
- **Conversation Card:** p-4, rounded-xl, hover transition, cursor-pointer
- **New Case Button:** w-full, py-3, rounded-full, font-semibold
- **Status Badge:** inline-flex, px-3 py-1, rounded-full, text-xs

### Forms
- **Textareas:** rounded-2xl, border-2, p-6, focus ring, min-height constraints
- **Radio Buttons:** Custom styled, rounded-full, min-h-12 click target
- **Checkboxes:** rounded-md, clear checked state
- **Input Labels:** font-medium, mb-2, block

### Buttons
- **Primary:** px-8 py-4, rounded-full, font-semibold, text-base
- **Secondary:** outlined, same sizing, rounded-full
- **Icon Buttons:** h-10 w-10, rounded-full, centered icon

### Cards & Containers
- **Panel Cards:** p-6 to p-8, rounded-xl, border, hover states where interactive
- **Summary Boxes:** p-8, rounded-2xl, border-l-4 accent
- **Citation Boxes:** p-6, rounded-xl, distinct border
- **Fact Cards:** p-6, rounded-xl, flex justify-between

### Icons & Badges
- **Icons:** Heroicons throughout for consistency
  - Chat bubbles for conversations
  - Document icons for reports
  - Check/alert icons for status
- **Badges:** rounded-full, px-3 py-1, text-xs, uppercase, font-medium

### Navigation
- Sidebar sticky navigation
- Active state clearly differentiated
- Back/forward navigation within case workflow

---

## Accessibility

### Focus Management
- All interactive elements: ring-2, ring-offset-2, rounded focus rings
- Skip to main content link
- Keyboard navigation through conversation list and forms

### ARIA & Screen Readers
- Conversation list role="list"
- Status announcements for AI processing
- Form labels explicitly associated
- Heading hierarchy h1 → h2 → h3 throughout

### Readability
- WCAG AA contrast minimum
- Legal text: text-base or larger, leading-relaxed
- Generous click targets (min 44x44px)
- Clear visual hierarchy with spacing

---

## Animation Guidelines

**Minimal, Purposeful Motion:**
- Conversation card hover: subtle scale (scale-102, duration-200)
- Screen transitions: fade-in (duration-300)
- Loading states: spinner during AI processing
- Radio/checkbox: subtle check animation (duration-150)

**Prohibited:**
- Scroll-triggered animations
- Auto-playing transitions
- Parallax effects
- Excessive motion

---

## Images

**No hero images needed.** This is a professional legal tool where trust comes from clean, functional interface design. The chat-based navigation and document-focused layouts rely on typography, spacing, and component clarity rather than decorative imagery.

client/src/pages/report.tsx.content:
import { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { motion } from "framer-motion"; import { Card } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Badge } from "@/components/ui/badge"; import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button"; import { FileText, Heart, GraduationCap, Download, ArrowLeft, Home, Copy, Check } from "lucide-react"; import { useLocation } from "wouter"; import CaseChat from "@/components/CaseChat"; import { useToast } from "@/hooks/use-toast"; import { useBackground } from "@/contexts/BackgroundContext"; export default function LegalReport() { const [, setLocation] = useLocation(); const { toast } = useToast(); const [copiedSection, setCopiedSection] = useState(null); const { setSuccess, setIdle } = useBackground(); useEffect(() => { setSuccess(); return () => setIdle(); }, [setSuccess, setIdle]); const reportDate = new Date().toLocaleDateString("en-US", { year: "numeric", month: "long", day: "numeric", }); const handleDownload = () => { console.log("Downloading report as PDF"); toast({ title: "Download Started", description: "Your legal report PDF is being generated...", }); }; const handleCopySection = async (sectionName: string, content: string) => { try { await navigator.clipboard.writeText(content); setCopiedSection(sectionName); toast({ title: "Copied to clipboard", description: `${sectionName} section copied successfully`, }); setTimeout(() => setCopiedSection(null), 2000); } catch (err) { toast({ title: "Copy failed", description: "Please try again", variant: "destructive", }); } }; const medicalContent = `MEDICAL TREATMENT RIGHTS Summary: Refugees in Switzerland have the right to urgent medical treatment regardless of their legal status. For life-threatening conditions, immediate access to healthcare facilities is guaranteed under the Swiss Asylum Act, with costs covered by cantonal emergency medical assistance programs. Legal Basis: Article 82 of the Swiss Asylum Act provides that asylum seekers and refugees are entitled to emergency medical care. Healthcare providers must ensure access to necessary medical services, including urgent treatments, surgeries, and ongoing care for chronic conditions that pose immediate health risks. Citation: "Persons in the asylum procedure and temporarily admitted persons are entitled to emergency medical care. The cantons shall ensure that healthcare is provided." Source: Swiss Asylum Act (AsylG), June 26, 1998, Article 82, Section 1`; const educationContent = `EDUCATION RIGHTS Summary: Refugee minors in Switzerland have the right to access public education, including secondary schools. This right extends to all children regardless of asylum status, ensuring continuity of education and integration into the Swiss education system. Legal Basis: The Swiss Federal Constitution guarantees the right to basic education for all children. This includes refugee children and asylum seekers under the age of 18. Cantonal education authorities are required to integrate refugee children into the regular school system, providing language support and educational resources as needed. Citation: "Every child has the right to basic education which is free of charge. Basic education is compulsory and is supervised by the state." Source: Swiss Federal Constitution, Article 19 & HarmoS Agreement, 2007`; return (

Legal Rights Report

Provisional assessment for refugee assistance

Case Number
UNHCR-CH-2024-00143
Generated
{reportDate}

Medical Treatment Rights

AI Summary

Refugees in Switzerland have the right to urgent medical treatment regardless of their legal status. For life-threatening conditions, immediate access to healthcare facilities is guaranteed under the Swiss Asylum Act, with costs covered by cantonal emergency medical assistance programs.

Legal Basis

Article 82 of the Swiss Asylum Act provides that asylum seekers and refugees are entitled to emergency medical care. Healthcare providers must ensure access to necessary medical services, including urgent treatments, surgeries, and ongoing care for chronic conditions that pose immediate health risks.

Source Citation

"Persons in the asylum procedure and temporarily admitted persons are entitled to emergency medical care. The cantons shall ensure that healthcare is provided."

Source: Swiss Asylum Act (AsylG), June 26, 1998, Article 82, Section 1

Education Rights

AI Summary

Refugee minors in Switzerland have the right to access public education, including secondary schools. This right extends to all children regardless of asylum status, ensuring continuity of education and integration into the Swiss education system.

Legal Basis

The Swiss Federal Constitution guarantees the right to basic education for all children. This includes refugee children and asylum seekers under the age of 18. Cantonal education authorities are required to integrate refugee children into the regular school system, providing language support and educational resources as needed.

Source Citation

"Every child has the right to basic education which is free of charge. Basic education is compulsory and is supervised by the state."

Source: Swiss Federal Constitution, Article 19 & HarmoS Agreement, 2007

Disclaimer: This report is generated using AI-assisted analysis and should be used as a preliminary assessment only. Always consult with qualified legal professionals for case-specific advice.

Generated by UNHCR Rights-Mapper | Confidential Legal Document

); }

client/src/components/ui/checkbox.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

client/src/components/ui/slider.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Slider = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <SliderPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative flex w-full touch-none select-none items-center",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <SliderPrimitive.Track className="relative h-2 w-full grow overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary">
      <SliderPrimitive.Range className="absolute h-full bg-primary" />
    </SliderPrimitive.Track>
    <SliderPrimitive.Thumb className="block h-5 w-5 rounded-full border-2 border-primary bg-background ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50" />
  </SliderPrimitive.Root>
))
Slider.displayName = SliderPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Slider }

client/src/components/ui/progress.tsx.content:
"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Progress = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ProgressPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative h-4 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ProgressPrimitive.Indicator
      className="h-full w-full flex-1 bg-primary transition-all"
      style={{ transform: `translateX(-${100 - (value || 0)}%)` }}
    />
  </ProgressPrimitive.Root>
))
Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Progress }

replit.md.content:
# UNHCR Rights-Mapper

## Overview

UNHCR Rights-Mapper is an AI-powered legal assistance tool designed for pro bono lawyers working with refugee cases. The application streamlines the process of analyzing unstructured case notes, extracting key information, and generating comprehensive legal reports with proper citations. Built for a 46-hour hackathon, it features a modern chat-based interface that tracks each case as a conversation thread while maintaining professional clarity and trust.

The application solves a critical problem: lawyers currently waste hours manually sifting through fragmented, multilingual legal documents to determine refugee rights. Rights-Mapper uses intelligent intake and AI-powered entity extraction to transform messy case notes into verified legal briefs automatically.

## User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

## Design Philosophy: "Perplexity-Inspired Modern Chat"

The intake page follows a Perplexity-inspired design philosophy focused on creating a clean, chat-like experience that feels natural and intuitive. The design emphasizes minimalism, auto-expanding inputs, and embedded action buttons—all while maintaining dark premium aesthetics and strategic use of an electric cyan accent exclusively for AI-powered elements.

## System Architecture

### Frontend Architecture

**Framework**: React with TypeScript using Vite as the build tool

**UI System**: The application uses shadcn/ui component library built on Radix UI primitives with Tailwind CSS for styling. The design follows a "Modern Professional Application with Chat Interface" pattern emphasizing clean, rounded components with generous whitespace.

**State Management**: 
- TanStack Query (React Query) for server state management
- React Context API for application-wide state (BackgroundContext for managing UI animation states)
- Local component state with React hooks

**Routing**: Wouter for lightweight client-side routing

**Key Design Decisions**:
- Three-page workflow: Smart Intake → Verification Dashboard → Legal Report
- **Perplexity-Style Intake Page**: Clean chat interface with collapsible sidebar, auto-expanding input, and embedded action buttons
- Chat-based sidebar for case history (visible on all pages, can be hidden)
- Command palette (Cmd/Ctrl+K) for professional, keyboard-driven navigation
- Dynamic animated background that responds to AI processing states (idle, thinking, success)
- Data stream loader visualization during report generation

**Perplexity-Style Design Elements (Intake Page - Latest)**:
1. **Centered Chat Layout**: Page title at top, Perplexity-style input container centered on page
2. **Auto-Expanding Textarea**: Grows from 56px to 200px max height as user types, then scrolls
3. **Embedded Action Buttons**: Paperclip (file attach) on left, circular cyan send arrow on right—both inside input border
4. **File Attachment Support**: Upload documents (.pdf, .doc, .docx, .txt), file badge shows filename, can remove and re-attach
5. **Rounded Input Container**: rounded-3xl border (24px), semi-transparent card background, backdrop blur frosted glass effect
6. **Electric Cyan Send Button**: Circular button with ArrowUp icon, cyan background + AI glow when enabled, 40% opacity when disabled
7. **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Enter to send, Shift+Enter for new line (chat-app style)
8. **Smart Button States**: Send button enables when text OR file present, disabled otherwise
9. **Sidebar Restored**: Collapsible sidebar visible on intake page (matching verification/report pages)
10. **Fluid Page Transitions**: Framer Motion animations on all pages—fade in/slide up (initial y:20), fade out/slide up (exit y:-20), 0.4s easeInOut timing

**Typography**:
- Primary: Inter for interface elements
- Legal content: Georgia/serif for reports and citations
- Monospace: JetBrains Mono for case IDs and timestamps

### Backend Architecture

**Server Framework**: Express.js with TypeScript

**Database ORM**: Drizzle ORM configured for PostgreSQL

**Storage Pattern**: The application implements an abstraction layer (`IStorage` interface) with an in-memory implementation (`MemStorage`) for development. This allows easy swapping to a database-backed storage in production without changing application logic.

**API Design**: RESTful API structure with `/api` prefix for all routes

**Development Setup**: 
- Vite middleware mode for HMR during development
- Custom logging middleware for request/response tracking
- Automatic source mapping for debugging

### Core Workflow Components

**1. Smart Intake (Screen 1)**
- Perplexity-style auto-expanding textarea for unstructured case notes
- File attachment support (paperclip button) for uploading legal documents
- Embedded action buttons inside rounded input container
- Keyboard shortcuts (Enter to send, Shift+Enter for new line)
- AI analyzes notes using LLM (Gemini 1.5 Pro or GPT-4) for Natural Language Understanding
- Extracts entities: host country, needs, complications, etc.

**2. Verification Dashboard (Screen 2)**
- Displays AI-extracted information for lawyer verification
- Interactive form to fill missing details (medical urgency, education level, additional factors)
- Uses radio groups, checkboxes, and form controls for structured data entry
- Chat component for clarifying questions with AI

**3. Legal Report (Screen 3)**
- Generates comprehensive legal brief with proper citations
- Organized sections: Executive Summary, Legal Framework, Analysis, Recommendations
- Copy-to-clipboard functionality for individual sections
- PDF download capability
- Professional serif typography for legal content

### UI/UX Enhancement Features (Futuristic Polish Layer)

**Command Palette**: Modern keyboard-first navigation using `cmdk` library, accessible via Cmd/Ctrl+K for professional quick actions:
- Start New Case - Navigate to intake page
- View Saved Reports - (Placeholder for future case history)
- Print Current Report - Triggers browser print dialog
- Help / Contact Support - (Placeholder for future help system)
- Implementation: Global keyboard listener with proper cleanup, CommandDialog component at app root

**Animated Background**: Dynamic "AI Brain" background with UN blue gradient that responds to application state via BackgroundContext:
- Idle state (30s animation): Slow, subtle gradient movement on intake page
- Thinking state (15s animation): Faster gradient flow during AI analysis
- Success state (25s animation): Brighter, calm gradient on verification/report pages
- Implementation: CSS-based radial gradients with configurable animation speed and opacity, -z-10 positioning for non-intrusive background layer

**Data Stream Loader**: Intelligent loading visualization during report generation that shows the "8 hours of legal work happening in 8 seconds":
- Displays 11 sequential legal research steps over ~5 seconds
- Steps include: "Analyzing Swiss Asylum Act Article 44...", "Cross-referencing EU Dublin III Regulation...", "Parsing German Medical Ordinance 4.2...", etc.
- Features animated progress bar and highlighted current step
- Automatically navigates to report page on completion
- Generate button disables during streaming to prevent duplicate triggers
- Implementation: Fixed overlay with streaming animation, automatic cleanup on unmount

**Chat Sidebar**: 
- Fixed width (w-80) persistent sidebar
- Displays case history with status badges (draft, verified, completed)
- Search functionality for finding cases
- Collapsible to maximize workspace

### Styling System

**Color System**: HSL-based color variables for light/dark mode support with semantic naming (primary, secondary, destructive, muted, accent)

**Spacing**: Tailwind spacing scale with emphasis on units: 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 20

**Border Radius**: Modern rounded corners (xl: 1.5rem, 2xl: 2rem) throughout for contemporary feel

**Elevation**: CSS variable-based elevation system (`--elevate-1`, `--elevate-2`) for hover/active states

**Interactive States**: 
- Hover elevation classes for subtle depth
- Active state compression for tactile feedback
- Outline borders with controlled opacity

## External Dependencies

### UI Component Libraries
- **Radix UI**: Comprehensive set of accessible, unstyled component primitives (accordion, alert-dialog, checkbox, dialog, dropdown-menu, popover, radio-group, scroll-area, select, separator, slider, switch, tabs, toast, tooltip)
- **shadcn/ui**: Pre-styled component system built on Radix UI and Tailwind CSS
- **cmdk**: Command palette/command menu implementation for keyboard-driven navigation
- **embla-carousel-react**: Carousel component for potential image/document galleries
- **vaul**: Drawer component for mobile-friendly overlays
- **lucide-react**: Icon library for consistent iconography

### Form Management
- **react-hook-form**: Form state management and validation
- **@hookform/resolvers**: Validation resolvers for react-hook-form
- **zod**: TypeScript-first schema validation
- **drizzle-zod**: Integration between Drizzle ORM and Zod for type-safe validation

### Data Fetching & State
- **@tanstack/react-query**: Asynchronous state management and data fetching
- **wouter**: Lightweight routing library

### Database & ORM
- **Drizzle ORM**: Type-safe SQL ORM for PostgreSQL
- **@neondatabase/serverless**: Neon serverless PostgreSQL driver
- **drizzle-kit**: CLI tool for schema management and migrations
- **connect-pg-simple**: PostgreSQL session store for Express (for potential authentication)

### Styling
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first CSS framework
- **class-variance-authority**: Utility for creating type-safe variant-based component APIs
- **clsx & tailwind-merge**: Utilities for conditional className construction

### Utilities
- **date-fns**: Date manipulation and formatting
- **nanoid**: Unique ID generation

### Development Tools
- **Vite**: Build tool and development server
- **TypeScript**: Type safety across the entire codebase
- **esbuild**: Fast JavaScript bundler for production builds
- **@replit/vite-plugin-runtime-error-modal**: Development error overlay
- **@replit/vite-plugin-cartographer**: Replit-specific development tooling
- **@replit/vite-plugin-dev-banner**: Development environment banner

### Planned AI Integration
The application is designed to integrate with:
- **Gemini 1.5 Pro** or **OpenAI GPT-4** for natural language understanding and entity extraction from unstructured case notes
- LLM APIs for generating legal analysis and recommendations with proper citations

### Session & Authentication (Prepared)
- Session management infrastructure is in place (`connect-pg-simple` for PostgreSQL sessions)
- User schema exists in database (username/password fields)
- Authentication routes not yet implemented but architecture supports future addition

client/src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }
